Moonshine_Bandits:
{{Short description|American country rap duo}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Moonshine Bandits | image = | image_size = | landscape = | alt = | caption = | alias = | origin = [[Los Banos, California]], [[United States]] | genre = [[Country rap]] [[Rap Rock]] | years_active = 2003–present | label = {{hlist|[[Suburban Noize Records|Suburban Noize]]|[[Average Joes Entertainment|AVJ Records]]|MSB Entertainment}} | associated_acts = {{hlist|[[Colt Ford]]|Durwood Black|[[The Lacs]]|[[Bubba Sparxxx]]}} | website = {{url|http://moonshinebandits.com/}} | current_members = Dusty "Tex" Dahlgren
Brett "Bird" Brooks | past_members = }} '''Moonshine Bandits''' is an American [[country rap]] group composed of Dusty "Tex" Dahlgren and Brett "Bird" Brooks.{{cite web|last=Jeffries|first=David|title=Moonshine Bandits {{!}} Biography|url={{Allmusic|class=artist|id=mn0000928079/biography|pure_url=yes}}|work=[[AllMusic]]|accessdate=September 4, 2014}} The duo formed in [[California]] in 2003 and has released a number of albums, the most recent being ''The Whiskey Never Dries'' released in August 2019. ==Music career== The duo was formed in [[California]] in 2003 and released their debut album, ''Soggy Crackerz''. They met up with Ty Weathers who is the founder of Burn County Music, which has continued to work closely in assisting majority of the Moonshine Bandits Blue Core/Dirt Rock sound. ''Soggy Crackerz'' was followed by ''Prohibition'' in 2006 and ''Divebars and Truckstops'' in 2010. Moonshine Bandits signed with [[Suburban Noize Records]] for the release of their fourth album, ''Whiskey and Women'', in 2011.{{cite news|title=Moonshine Bandits Sign A Record Deal|url=http://skopemag.com/2010/12/08/moonshine-bandits-sign-a-record-deal|accessdate=September 4, 2014|work=[[Skope Magazine]]|date=December 8, 2010}} The music video for "My Kind of Country" premiered on [[CMT Music|CMT Pure Country]] in February 2012 with a special appearance by Mike Allsup (The Bearded Guy playing the guitar) from [[Modesto, California]].{{cite news|title=Los Banos' Moonshine Bandits premier new video, 'My Kind of Country'|url=http://www.mercedsunstar.com/2012/02/21/2239373/los-banos-moonshine-bandits-premier.html|accessdate=September 4, 2014|work=[[Merced Sun-Star]]|date=February 21, 2012}} In 2014, they partnered with [[Average Joes Entertainment]] for their fifth album ''[[Calicountry]]''.{{cite news|last1=Conaway|first1=Alanna|title=The Moonshine Bandits to Release New Album Through Average Joes Entertainment|url=http://roughstock.com/news/the-moonshine-bandits-to-release-new-album-through-average-joes-entertainment/|accessdate=September 4, 2014|work=Roughstock|date=September 5, 2013|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140905004321/http://roughstock.com/news/the-moonshine-bandits-to-release-new-album-through-average-joes-entertainment/|archive-date=September 5, 2014|url-status=dead}} ''Calicountry'' sold 3,000 copies in its first week of release, debuting at number 22 on the ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]'' [[Top Country Albums]] chart and number 126 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]].{{cite news|last1=Bjorke|first1=Matt|title=Country Album Chart News: The Week of February 12, 2014: Florida Georgia Line #1, Eric Paslay Debuts Top 5; Whiskey Myers, Moonshine Bandits, Scotty McCreery|url=http://roughstock.com/news/country-album-chart-news-the-week-of-february-12-2014-florida-georgia-line-1-eric-paslay-debuts-top-5-whiskey-myers-moonshine-bandits-scotty-mccreery/|accessdate=September 4, 2014|work=Roughstock|date=February 12, 2014|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140905004322/http://roughstock.com/news/country-album-chart-news-the-week-of-february-12-2014-florida-georgia-line-1-eric-paslay-debuts-top-5-whiskey-myers-moonshine-bandits-scotty-mccreery/|archive-date=September 5, 2014|url-status=dead}} Their sixth album, ''[[Blacked Out]]'', was released in July 2015, and it debuted at No.158 on the [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] and No. 13 on the Top Country Albums chart, No. 10 on the Top Rap Albums chart, selling 4,000 copies in its debut week.{{cite news|title=Country Album Chart Report for July 28, 2015|url=http://roughstock.com/news/2015/07/36603-country-album-chart-report-july-28-2015 |last= Bjorke|first=Matt |publisher=Roughstock |date= July 28, 2015 }} Sales figure given [https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1_bRZs8MP6YBv3ww5nYxeGefsT_tgpVFDy4k5J-EAGRw/edit#gid=0 here] ==Discography== ===Albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2" style="width:14em;"| Title ! rowspan="2" style="width:18em;"| Album details ! colspan="5"| Peak chart positions ! rowspan="2" style="width:8em;"| Sales |- style="font-size:smaller;" ! width="45" | [[Billboard 200|US]]
